intro: Diachroa maritima, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in saline environments, making it well adapted to coastal dunes and sandy soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Diachroa maritima plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
